relatedanime.anime: Kidou Senshi Gundam 0080: Pocket no Naka no Sensou
Kidou Senshi Gundam: Dai 08 MS Shoutai
Kidou Senshi Gundam MS IGLOO: 1-nen Sensou Hiroku
Kidou Senshi Gundam II: Ai Senshi Hen
Kidou Senshi Gundam III: Meguriai Sora Hen
Zeonic Front: Kidou Senshi Gundam 0079 - Zeon no Hifun
Akai Shouzou: Char, Soshite Frontal e
Mokei Senshi Gunpla Builders Beginning G
Kidou Senshi Gundam Senki: Avant Title
Kidou Senshi Gundam: Tekketsu no Orphans

recommendations.recommendation: WHy is this so great? The graphic is outdated, the direction is weak, the story has a lot of problems. BUT. If you ask me this is really the first anime that leaves behind the approach that anime is something only for children and starts developing a story that even an adult can enjoy. If you see it from this perspective this is probably the most important anime in hystory.
This is a 100% MUST-WATCH anime! I can guarantee you will like it, no matter what types of anime you prefer! It`s a classic! Great realistic story, a lot of kick-ass robot and spaceship battles!

Anime itself is far from perfect, but you definitely should watch it.
One reason is that there`s a lot of jokes based on Gundam quotes in other series. You`d miss them otherwise.
The other reason is that while not perfect, this anime is quite good. If you overlook some childish points, it`s pretty deep.
AWESOME ! Must Watch Anime ! It got nice story, the mecha feel very real, it`s a World War movie, only in space !

Do not listen to those basher comment. A must see for non graphic whore, non romance fans, military action kick-ass with realistic story. Separate yourself from narutard generation mindset(like most of comment in here which annoy me), and you can enjoy this show. Ground breaking series from mecha genre. Do not dare call yourself otaku till you watch this. This series is what the "true" otaku must watch. Gundam 0079 has become Japan national icon. Even non nerd in Japan knows who Amuro Ray is. This comment comes from a guy who watched all different kind of anime genre from 70`s until now. So you can take my word for it.

To be honest, this was one of the best anime series I`ve ever watched, the best Gundam series without a doubt. The characters, their development, the soundtrack and most importantly the story, were all perfect.

Considering Gundam is a cultural icon in Japan, there`s really no reason any self-proclaimed anime fan shouldn`t have watched it. Very retro style and music, but still among the best Gundam series ever made.

anime.description: September U.C. 0079 - December U.C. 0079 In the year Universal Century 0079,The Principality of Zeon invents a gigantic human-shaped weapon called the Mobile Suit (MS) and begins its war for independence against the Earth Federation. The story depicts the life of young boys and girls in the war, focusing on the young protagonist named http://anidb.net/ch3971 [Amuro Ray]. Amuro becomes the pilot of the Gundam, a prototype MS developed by Federation Force. Through his battles against the ace pilot of Zeon, http://anidb.net/ch3974 [Char Aznable], and the bitter trials of the war, he become aware of his uniqueness as a NewType.

tag.name: maintenance tags
tag.description: These tags are used for maintenance.

tag.name: military
tag.description: The military, also known as the armed forces, are forces authorized and legally entitled to use deadly force so as to support the interests of the state and its citizens. The task of the military is usually defined as defence of the state and its citizens and the prosecution of war against foreign powers. The military may also have additional functions within a society, including construction, emergency services, social ceremonies, and guarding critical areas. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: extrasensory perception
tag.description: Extrasensory perception (ESP), involves reception of information not gained through the recognized physical senses but sensed with the mind. The term was coined by Sir Richard Burton, and adopted by Duke University psychologist J. B. Rhine to denote psychic abilities such as telepathy and clairvoyance, and their trans-temporal operation as precognition or retrocognition. ESP is also sometimes casually referred to as a sixth sense, gut instinct or hunch, which are historical English idioms. The term implies acquisition of information by means external to the basic limiting assumptions of science, such as that organisms can only receive information from the past to the present. In Japanese usage the term is often misappropriated to refer to any supernatural, non-magical, super power. Users of such powers are called `esper` in Japanese. The term `esper` is not normally in use outside of Japan but is slowly being introduced due to its usage in anime and manga. In anime/manga the following powers, among others, are described as ESP: - telepathy - precognition - clairvoyance - retrocognition - remote viewing - aura reading - out-of-body experiences (OBE) - psychokinesis

tag.name: robot
tag.description: A robot is an automatically guided machine, able to do tasks on its own. Another common characteristic is that by its appearance or movements, a robot often conveys a sense that it has intent or agency of its own. Not to be confused with android (human-like robot).

tag.name: dynamic
tag.description: Some of the central structural elements in anime are: Plot Continuity How does the plot or several plots unfold. Are they a strictly linear retelling of one big continuing story, a serial, possibly with several side stories, or is the content chopped into a set of unconnected episodes, only sharing the same setting and characters? Stereotype Characters Then there is the question of the character set presentation. Is it completely original, or is it your usual stereotypical character cast. Both choices have their merit, for example it would not really make much sense to reinvent the wheel for a harem anime. Fans of that genre come to expect their favourite stereotype protagonists. Plot Twists Finally there is the question of how complex the plot / the story unfolds. Are there side-plots that merge into the main plot leading to unexpected plot twists, or is the anime quite predictable? The latter would not be appropriate for detective stories. In harem anime on the other hand a foreseeable outcome is actually something the fans will come to expect.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: time
tag.description: This placeholder lists different epochs in human history and more vague but important timelines such as the future, the present and the past.

tag.name: place
tag.description: The places the anime can take place in. Includes more specific places such as a country on Earth, as well as more general places such as a dystopia or a mirror world.

tag.name: swordplay
tag.description: The act or art of using a sword or similar weapon skillfully.

tag.name: super power
tag.description: Be it an ancient Greek Heracles, a cybernetic muscle-man, or a fourteen year-old girl in a mini-skirted sailor suit. As long as they have super powers, they`re in the show.

tag.name: future
tag.description: Anime that fall under the future category are the ones that have a society that could have originated from ours. In most cases it should go hand to hand with sci-fi since we expect the future to consist of advanced technology, however, in the case where it`s explicitly stated in the story that the anime takes place "x years into the future", the state of technology doesn`t matter as long as it`s long into the future. The anime can be set in an alternative universe not tied with our own, as long as it has a futuristic feel to it. This category sports quite a lot of anime, mostly stemming from SciFi, but not necessarily only from there.

tag.name: space
tag.description: The final frontier.

tag.name: Earth
tag.description: The Earth is the third planet from the Sun, and the densest and fifth-largest of the eight planets in the Solar System. It is in effect a ball of hot mud, but on the surface it`s cold enough, so most of us live on it (or are supposed to). It is circa 4.5 billion years old, and, unless we humans succeed in destroying it over the next couple of centuries, it is expected to last for quite another while, though the changes in the Sun`s emissions due to its aging will likely cause the extinction of everything; the species of earthlings are guaranteed to die, even if we fail to kill them -- unless, of course, we find ourselves another planet and figure out a way to take everything there. Our little planet on a corner of this galaxy may mean nothing in the grand scheme of things, but to its inhabitants it is their home, so, as a species, we cherish it dearly, to the point many cultures even to this day deify it. Being the home to the human civilizations, the Earth is the main setting of most fiction, be it anime or otherwise, but not only are many titles set in other places, such as unrelated fantasy worlds, in a considerable number of fictional titles the Earth is actually destroyed by aggressive alien invaders.

tag.name: mecha
tag.description: Mecha in Japanese basically means mechanical things; everything from an electric whisk or a car to a spaceship or a robot. Here however we limit it to the more exotic things usually referred to as mecha anime: robots, whether controlled by a human or not, and their ilk. See Androids, Piloted Robots, Power Suits, Robot Helpers, Transforming Robots for a more specific classification.

tag.name: space travel
tag.description: Space Travel usually refers going to space or travelling there with or without a spacecraft. There are different forms of space travel like Interplanetary travel, Interstellar travel or Intergalactic travel. Since it isn`t possible to travel faster than light, most anime series involve some sort "sub-space travel mechanism" as a way to travel faster than light.

tag.name: transforming craft
tag.description: A transforming craft is an object built by humans or other intelligent lifeforms, usually a robot but sometimes also a vehicle of some sort, that can rearrange its parts in order to switch between a minimum of two forms.

tag.name: piloted robot
tag.description: Piloted Robots are, as the name suggests, robots that cannot control themselves; they need to be steered from somewhere, this can be from a human sitting inside or a remote controlled option.

tag.name: shipboard
tag.description: Beam me up, Scotty! Space stations (think Death Star) also count. Basically, this category is to tell if the setting takes place onboard a spaceship in space. This category is not applicable if the spaceship lies on a planet and never actually gets into space.

tag.name: space colony
tag.description: The human race (or possibly some alien race) has mastered space travel and founded at least one colony either in space, on a moon or another planet. This usually also includes colony-life episodes that not only show the technical staff of professionals (astronauts, scientists, etc.), but also their families (i.e. children).

tag.name: plot continuity
tag.description: Consistency of the characteristics of persons, plot, objects, places and events seen by the viewer. A single linear focused plot is highly continuous. A truly random plot is highly discontinuous.

tag.name: new
tag.description: Not based on anything, the story is a new work, usually made up by the people involved in creating the anime. Generally if an original work (原作) credit is given, it will be to the studio, or director, or other members of the production team.

tag.name: action
tag.description: Action anime usually involve a fairly straightforward story of good guys versus bad guys, where most disputes are resolved by using physical force. It often contains a lot of shooting, explosions and fighting.

tag.name: angst
tag.description: A feeling of general discomfort and uneasiness is present due to either trivial or more serious reasons, often accompanied by depression. Warning: may contain copious amounts of brooding and sighing. Etymology: "Angst" is a German word meaning fear or anxiety.

tag.name: science fiction
tag.description: Science fiction stories usually focus on how situations could be different in the future when we are more technologically advanced; due to either our own achievements or having met with other civilizations whom we have learned from.

tag.name: romance
tag.description: Romance describes a story that deals with love between two or more characters typically also having an optimistic ending. Romance is also a difficulty encountered when creating a harem.

tag.name: disaster
tag.description: A disaster is a large-scale situation that causes great loss of or damage or threat to life, health, property, society, or the environment, irrespective of its source or cause. Disasters have substantial, long-lasting negative repercussions, and great effort must be spent in order to undo or mitigate their effects.

tag.name: tragedy
tag.description: Tragedy is a form of drama characterized by seriousness and dignity, usually involving a conflict between a character and some higher power, such as the law, the gods, fate, or society.

tag.name: coming of age
tag.description: In the strict sense the Coming of age describes a young person`s transition from adolescence to adulthood. In anime the term is used in a more general sense where the protagonists have to face a challenge, make an important decision in their life, take on responsibility, or learn a lesson, and by overcoming these obstacles they reach a higher level of maturity.

tag.name: war
tag.description: War is a phenomenon of organized violent conflict, typified by extreme aggression, societal disruption and adaptation, and high mortality. The objective of warfare differs in accord with a group`s role in a conflict: The goals of offensive warfare are typically the submission, assimilation or destruction of another group, while the goals of defensive warfare are simply the repulsion of the offensive force and, often, survival itself. Relative to each other, combatants in warfare are called enemies. The terms military, militant, and militarism each refer to fundamental aspects of war, i.e. the organized group, the combative individual, and the supportive ethos (respectively). Source: wiki

tag.name: unsorted
tag.description: a bunch of tags that still need to be either deleted or moved into proper places.

tag.name: parricide
tag.description: Parricide, or the murder of family members, is the act of taking the life of of one or more of one`s own close family members, or even one`s entire family; that may include spouses, parents, grandparents, children, grandchildren, siblings, cousins, uncles, aunts, nephews, and nieces, among others.

tag.name: impact event
tag.description: An impact event is a collision between celestial objects causing measurable effects. Impact events have physical consequences and have been found to regularly occur in planetary systems, though the most frequent involve asteroids, comets or meteoroids and have minimal impact. When large objects impact terrestrial planets like the Earth, there can be significant physical and biospheric consequences, though atmospheres mitigate many surface impacts through atmospheric entry. Impact structures are dominant landforms on many celestial solid objects and present the strongest empirical evidence for their frequency and scale. In fiction, an impact event is a common way to end the world as we know it, either through the impact itself or through its aftermath, and it may happen either naturally or through human hands; this may include man-made objects, such as space debris and fictional space colonies. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: Universal Century
tag.description: Refers to the Universal Century timeline in Gundam anime. Gundam anime with this tag all belong in the same universe.

tag.name: space Nazis
tag.description: The term space Nazi refers to any futuristic society or group, whose appearance, politics, or culture are modelled after the Nazis.

tag.name: world government
tag.description: When a whole planet (e.g. Earth or a fictional planet) has one single government.

tag.name: kids in war
tag.description: When minors participate in armed conflict.

tag.name: Bright slap
tag.description: "You hit me! Not even my father ever hit me!" You are the commander of a spaceship, leader of a faction or a team and your best mecha pilot stops fighting and grows increasingly hysterical and angsty, while the enemy could strike you at any time. What are you going to do? You slap or punch him, preferably in the face, and back to his senses while delivering a heroic speech that would turn any wimp into a man of destiny. Named after Bright Noa of Mobile Suit Gundam, a prominent user of this for-sure method.

tag.name: space battles
tag.description: There are space battles in this anime. Usually between Earth forces and some alien invader, but ship to ship skirmishes in deep space are just as common.

tag.name: murder
tag.description: To murder means to bring about someone else`s death, by a voluntary act. Whether it comes from the killer`s own hand or by exposing the victim to life-threatening circumstances, the result is foreseeable and sought by the perpetrator. Someone who murders as their profession/job is an http://anidb.net/t2399 [assassin or hitman].

tag.name: real robot
tag.description: A smaller form of mecha with no special abilities. They are mostly used by deploying them in battle just like modern tanks. They can be mass produced and their pilots (usually military officers or soldiers) are (mostly) interchangeable. Tanks are often a threat to them and they are more easily destroyed than their bigger counterparts.

tag.name: war-zone realities
tag.description: War is hell. This tag is for when characters experience the hell of war... not just the exciting stuff blowing up part.

tag.name: hard science fiction
tag.description: Hard science fiction is a category of http://anidb.net/t2846 [science fiction] characterised by an emphasis on scientific accuracy, technical detail, or both. The term is not defined precisely, and is often seen as an approximate way of describing works. Stories revolving around scientific and technical consistency were written as early as 1860s and 1870s; http://anidb.net/cr5973 [Jules Verne] is generally considered the creator of the genre. Although not always accurate in his scientific depictions, and though Verne himself denied writing as a scientist or seriously predicting machines and technology of the future, the attention to detail in his work became an inspiration for many future scientists and explorers. Nowadays, the term http://anidb.net/t7086 [soft science fiction] is also often used to refer to science fiction stories which lack scientific focus or rigorous adherence to known science; the categorization "hard science fiction" thus represents a position on a broad continuum ranging from "softer" to "harder". There is a degree of flexibility in how far from "real science" a story can stray before it leaves the realm of hard science fiction; some authors scrupulously avoid such technology as faster-than-light travel, while others accept such notions but focus on realistically depicting the worlds that such a technology might make possible. In this view, a story`s scientific "hardness" is less a matter of the absolute accuracy of the science content than of the rigour and consistency with which the various ideas and possibilities are worked out. Furthermore, later discoveries do not necessarily invalidate the label of hard science fiction; the designation remains valid even when a crucial plot element is later discovered to be incorrect. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: Zaku
tag.description: A mobile suit type from the Gundam series.

tag.name: call my name
tag.description: "TETSUOOOOOO!!" "KANEDAAAAAA!!" "TAMAHOMEEEE!!" "MIAKAAAA!!" Feelings of any kind towards other characters are best shown by calling each other`s name, loud, REALLY LOUD. For better effect at least twice or thrice. For lover`s couples and mortal enemies it is a requirement to run towards each other while calling each other`s name, unaware of the surroundings.

tag.name: red ones go faster
tag.description: Red things just seem to go faster. In fiction, make something red and you can almost guarantee it`ll move quicker, as if the colour itself reduces drag, lowers inertia and increases forward momentum. A visual shorthand for getting the point across that an object is zippy. Truth in Television: Red apparently promotes adrenalin release and feelings of excitement or intensity, which can certainly give the appearance that a red object is moving faster, as well as possibly encourage the drivers of red vehicles to push the envelope more. Also, the Doppler Effect makes things red-shifted if they`re moving away from you at a high speed (read: significant fraction of the speed of light). Don`t expect there to be any evolutionary basis for this, however, as it`s unlikely any human would ever get to see it with the naked eye. Source: TVTrope

tag.name: TO BE MOVED TO CHARACTER
tag.description: Tags under this parent tag are going to be moved to character tags and removed from the anime they`re currently assigned to. They will be blocked from the anime system once that move is complete. Please help with that job if you know what characters they should be assigned to.

tag.name: technical aspects
tag.description: It may sometimes be useful to know about technical aspects of a show, such as information about its broadcasting or censorship. Such information can be found here.

tag.name: multi-anime projects
tag.description: Many anime are created as part of larger projects encompassing many shows without direct relation to one another. Normally, there is a specific idea in mind: for example, the http://anidb.net/t4859 [Young Animator Training Project] aims to stimulate the on-the-job training of next-generation professionals of the anime industry, whereas the http://anidb.net/t3763 [World Masterpiece Theatre] aims to animate classical stories from all over the world.

tag.name: tropes
tag.description: A trope is a commonly recurring literary and rhetorical devices, motifs or clichés in creative works. This use is a broader redefining of a literary trope, the use of figurative language, via word, phrase, or even an image, for artistic effect, such as using a figure of speech. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: death
tag.description: Death is the state of no longer being alive or the process of ceasing to be alive.

tag.name: speculative fiction
tag.description: Speculative fiction is an umbrella genre encompassing fiction with certain elements that do not exist in the real world, often in the context of supernatural, futuristic or other imaginative themes. This includes, but is not limited to, science fiction, fantasy, superhero fiction, horror, utopian and dystopian fiction, fairytale fantasy, supernatural fiction, as well as combinations thereof. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: Super Robot Wars
tag.description: Super Robot Wars is a series of tactical role-playing video games produced by Banpresto. The main feature of the franchise is having a story that crosses over several popular mecha anime, manga and video games, allowing characters and mecha from different titles to team up or battle one another. Due to the nature of crossover games and licensing involved, only a few games have been released outside Japan, and in English; early English-language games only feature Banpresto`s original characters and mecha, and a flagship installment were to never be released until 2016, with the English release of Super Robot Wars V in Southeast Asian countries. The franchise celebrated its 25th anniversary in 2016. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Principality of Zeon
character.description: The Republic of Zeon was initially founded by Zeon Zum Deikun, who declared the colony located at the second Earth-Luna Lagrangian Point, named Side 3, independent from the Earth Federation in U.C.0058. For the next several years, Zeon Zum Deikun and his followers dealt with diplomatic issues surrounding their independence, chiefly the economic pressure applied to Side 3 by the Earth Federation, in their efforts to force Side 3 back into the Federation. During this time, Side 3 formed its first national guard unit. Unfortunately, for the Republic of Zeon, Zeon Zum Deikun unexpectedly died (almost certainly assassinated by the Zabis) in UC 0068, leaving Side 3 without a leader. After the end of the One Year War, the Republic was re-established with a pro-Earth Federation puppet government.

character.name: Earth Federation
character.description: The unified world government that launched the space settlement program and now rules over both Earth and the space colonies. Its main decision-making body is the Earth Federation Assembly, which meets occasionally to pass new legislation. Though not as cruel and aggressive as the Principality of Zeon`s leaders, the bureaucrats who rule over the Earth Federation are corrupt, weak-willed, and insensitive to the space colonists` desire for independence. After the One Year War, the Federation decides to concentrate its energies on reconstructing Earth instead of the space colonies, further increasing political tensions.

character.name: Earth Federation Forces
character.description: The military arm of the Earth Federation. The Federation Forces are divided into several branches, including land, sea, air, and space forces. Until mass production of the RGM-79 GM begins in the final weeks of the One Year War, the Federation Forces are forced to battle the Principality of Zeon`s mobile suits using conventional tanks, planes, and space fighters. Even in the postwar years, the Federation Forces are usually inferior to their opponents in terms of skill, morale, and equipment.

character.name: Earth Federation Space Force
character.description: The space branch of the Federation Forces, established in U.C. 0059 in response to Side 3`s declaration of independence. The Federation Space Force is headquartered at Luna II, and after the One Year War it also maintains outposts at many space colonies and at asteroid bases such as Konpeitoh. The EFSF fleet is primarily made up of Salamis-class space cruisers, upgraded versions of which remain in service even after the introduction of newer models.

character.name: Bright Noa
character.description: Bright is an officer cadet, with just six months` service under his belt, when the assault carrier White Base arrives at Side 7. Hours later, after a savage surprise attack by Zeon mobile suits, he finds himself the ship`s only surviving officer. As acting captain of the White Base, Bright rises to the occasion and leads his crew of civilian recruits through one crisis after another. However, his strict leadership often creates friction with his headstrong pilots, especially Amuro. Source: Official Site

character.name: Amuro Ray
character.description: Amuro is the hero of our story, and the pilot of the mighty mobile suit RX-78 Gundam. As the series begins, he is a civilian living at the Side 7 research colony, the neglected son of a Federation Forces engineer. When Zeon mobile suits attack the colony, Amuro commandeers the prototype Gundam and defeats the invaders. He soon finds himself part of the substitute crew of the Federation warship White Base, and this moody young man begins to develop strong bonds with his newfound "family." Meanwhile, Amuro`s increasing fighting skills suggest that he has potential far beyond that of ordinary mortals... Source: Official Site

character.name: Char Aznable
character.description: Known as the "Red Comet" for his high-speed attack tactics, Char is the most famous of Zeon`s ace mobile suit pilots. He earned his nickname by destroying five Federation battleships during the Battle of Loum, and after the attack on Side 7, he becomes the dreaded nemesis of the White Base crew. However, defeating the Federation isn`t the only thing on Char`s mind, and his distinctive mask hides the face of a young man bent on his own personal quest for revenge. As the story continues, Char begins putting his own complicated schemes into motion, even as he becomes distracted by his growing rivalry with the Gundam`s pilot. Source: Official Site

character.name: Ramba Ral
character.description: This veteran guerilla soldier is a member of Dozle Zabi`s Space Attack Force, dispatched to Earth in order to avenge Garma Zabi by destroying the White Base. Cunning and experienced, he proves to be our heroes` toughest opponent yet, but his efforts are undercut by the scheming and feuding of the Zabi family. Ultimately, cut off from supplies or reinforcements, Ramba Ral and his men must resort to launching a suicidal infantry assault on the White Base.

character.name: Haro
character.description: Haro is the mechanical mascot of the Gundam science fiction anime metaseries, and is the only character that appears in more than one timeline. The original Haro is a little robot companion built by the main character Amuro Ray. It is a cute testament to Amuro`s exceptional talent for machines. Haro`s features include a limited range of speech, and the ability to hover (in environments with atmosphere and low gravity) by flapping its ear-like appendage coverings. Haro can usually be found rolling behind Amuro`s next door neighbor Frau Bow. The ability to detect brain waves is also one of Haro`s functions; in one of the episodes, Haro actually claimed that the brain wave of Amuro was lowered/different. In Zeta Gundam, a mass-produced Mk-II version of Haro ends up in the hands of that series` main protagonist Kamille Bidan, who initially suspects it to be the original. He repairs the robot, only to have it constantly address him as Amuro. During the events of Char`s Counterattack, Amuro gives a "third-generation" Haro to Hathaway, the son of his captain Bright Noa. Haro continues to permeate the Gundam franchise, having appeared in Gundam SEED as Lacus Clyne`s multi-colored horde of simple-speech robot pets, built for her by Athrun Zala. These Haros are roughly 1/4 the size of their Universal Century counterparts and are similar in function, however a few possess certain abilities such as unlocking doors. Lacus`s favorite Haro is a pink machine that she refers to as "Pink-Chan" (often translated as "Mr. Pink" or "Pinky"). Another notable Haro in Lacus`s collection is "Navy-Chan", a navy blue robot on which she paints a mustache bearing a distinct resemblance the facial ornament of the ∀ Gundam of the CC (正歴 Seireki) calendar system. The rest of Lacus` Haros have been seen in yellow, orange, blue, green, and black. The parody comic Mobile Suit Gundam SEED Club Yonkoma states that Athrun has built a total of 35 Haros for Lacus. In Mobile Suit Gundam 00, Celestial Being had produced unknown numbers of Haros as an assistant of daily maintenance works. Currently at least 6 unique Haros have appeared in the animation production. The Haros in the series took much more maintenance and combat role than any other series` counterpart, usually seeing them operating with various machines, including mobile weapons.

character.name: Sayla Mass
character.description: At the beginning of the Mobile Suit Gundam TV series, Sayla is a civilian of Side 7, who comes aboard the mobile suit carrier White Base along with other civilians include Amuro Ray, Fraw Bow, Hayato Kobayashi, Kai Shiden and Mirai Yashima. Sayla is a Newtype much like her brother Char Aznable. Originally a medical student on Side 7, Sayla is almost immediately recruited as a soldier, and set to the task of watching over the civilian refugees. With the near total lack of experienced personnel to defend White Base (most original regular officers were KIA in Zeon`s Side 7 attack), Bright Noa assigns Sayla to the multiple positions of communications officer, medical officer, navigator, and finally combat pilot. Soon after joining the ship, she repeatedly looks for her brother Casval, and takes every opportunity to learn information about him and make contact. When Bright picks up a suspicious briefcase (later revealed to be full of gold bars) intended for Sayla, he confronts her and she admits that her true identity as Artesia Som Deikun, sister to Casval Rem Deikun (better known as Char Aznable), and the only daughter of Zeon Zum Deikun, the founder of the Republic of Zeon.

character.name: Hayato Kobayashi
character.description: Hayato, with his black belt in judo, would be the first to warn you not underestimate him just because of his size. After the attack on Side 7, the pint-sized Hayato joins the White Base crew and volunteers for pilot training, largely out of a sense of rivalry with his former neighbor Amuro. Though his fighting skills can`t compare to Amuro`s, Hayato is loyal, fearless, and determined.

character.name: Kai Shiden
character.description: Another of the White Base`s crew of civilian recruits, Kai is a confirmed coward and cynic - the smart-mouthed black sheep of the White Base crew. While his fellow pilots are struggling to save the ship, Kai can often be found cowering behind them, or mocking them from the sidelines. Still, he`ll do his part when he must, and as the series continues Kai begins to understand what he and his comrades are fighting for.

character.name: Ryu Jose
character.description: The jovial Ryu, a Federation Forces pilot trainee, is one of the only survivors of the White Base`s original crew. Ryu`s combination of good humour and military background lets him intercede between uptight captain Bright and the ship`s civilian pilots. Despite his training, Ryu is a fairly reckless pilot, often rushing into the middle of battle in a puny Core Fighter in an attempt to help out his fellow pilots.

character.name: Fraw Bow
character.description: Fraw, Amuro`s friend and neighbor at Side 7, is first seen nagging Amuro about his skipped breakfast. After they escape the colony aboard the White Base, Fraw begins focusing her baby-sitting efforts on the ship`s complement of mischievous refugee children. Later in the series, she adds to her workload by joining the White Base`s medical staff... all of which helps distract her from Amuro`s growing distance.

character.name: Mirai Yashima
character.description: Mirai is another of the civilians who joins the White Base crew after the attack on Side 7. Her training as a space glider pilot makes her the best choice to take the White Base`s helm, and Mirai soon becomes Bright`s trusted deputy and a surrogate mother to the ship`s young crew. She is also the daughter of a powerful and well-connected family, which causes complications later in the series.

character.name: General Revil
character.description: The gruff and grizzled Revil is a high-ranking commander in the Earth Federation Forces, and the leader of some of the Federation`s most important counteroffensives against the Zeons. He takes a particular interest in the White Base and its crew, sending them supplies and experimental weapons through somewhat unorthodox channels. Whether he`s genuinely concerned for their welfare or simply observing how they perform under stress, Revil is nonetheless one of the White Base`s only sources of support.

character.name: Matilda Ajan
character.description: Matilda Ajan is an officer of the Federation Forces` supply corps, who appears whenever the White Base`s need is most dire in order to deliver vital supplies, new equipment, and repair services. She also seems to function as a personal envoy for General Revil, carrying messages back and forth between this high-ranking commander and the beleaguered ship. And not only is pretty Matilda the White Base`s guardian angel, but also the dream girl of its lovestruck male crew.

character.name: Sleggar Law
character.description: Swaggering, cocky Sleggar is a late addition to the White Base crew, assigned to the ship after it reaches the Federation Forces headquarters at Jaburo. While initially condescending to his under-age crewmates, he soon develops a mutual respect for them, and becomes a valuable member of the White Base`s pilot team.

character.name: Tem Ray
character.description: Tem Ray is the father of Amuro Ray and is considered to be the scientific mind behind the Federation`s Mobile Suit (V Project) series, and the creator of the original RX-78-2 Gundam.

character.name: Garma Zabi
character.description: The handsome youngest son of the Zabi family, dashing Garma is Degwin`s favorite and the darling of Zeon`s citizens. Garma is the nominal commander of Zeon`s Earth Attack Force, which controls two-thirds of the planet`s surface. Given his youth and inexperience, it`s clear Garma owes his position to his family`s favour, and he is desperate to prove himself worthy of it. When his military-academy buddy Char Aznable drives the White Base into his territory, Garma is easily persuaded to risk his life in pursuit of this grand trophy.

character.name: Gihren Zabi
character.description: Gihren is the oldest of Degwin Zabi`s children, and the commander-in-chief of the Zeon military. With an IQ of 240, plenty of charisma, and a gift for rousing speeches, Gihren has been able to seize the reins of power and reduce his father to little more than a figurehead. To this intellectual monster, exterminating half the human race in this ferocious war has been just a stepping-stone to eventual world domination.

character.name: Degwin Sodo Zabi
character.description: Degwin is the patriarch of the Zabi family which rules the Principality of Zeon. Ten years ago, the revolutionary leader Zeon Zum Deikun - the man who led the space colonies of Side 3 to independence - expired under suspicious circumstances, leaving Degwin as his apparent successor. Degwin then established the Principality and led it to war against the Earth Federation. But now, after a year of conflict, the old tyrant has grown weary of the fighting, and his ambitious son Gihren has usurped much of Degwin`s power.

character.name: Dozle Zabi
character.description: After Gihren, Dozle is the next oldest of Degwin Zabi`s surviving children. This scarred veteran is the commander of Zeon`s Space Attack Force, which is based at the asteroid fortress Solomon. Dozle is a born soldier, to whom nothing is more important than honor, duty, and the glory of battle. Despite his ferocious appearance, he`s a loyal family man, devoted to his younger brother Garma, his wife Zenna, and his infant daughter Mineva.

character.name: Kycilia Zabi
character.description: The sly, suspicious Kycilia is Degwin Zabi`s only known daughter. She is the commander of Zeon`s Mobile Assault Force, based at the lunar city of Granada, and also the direct superior of her brother Garma. Kycilia is a clever and innovative tactician, and the driving force behind Zeon`s mobile suit and mobile armour development. However, her rivalry with her brothers increasingly undermines Zeon`s efforts to hold its own against the resurgent Earth Federation.

character.name: Lalah Sune
character.description: This young woman is a test subject of the Flanagan Institute, a Zeon research organization created to investigate the gifted humans known as "newtypes." While the exploits of pilots like Char and Amuro have led to speculation that they may be newtypes, Lalah`s powers are obvious and undeniable, and accompanied by a profound spiritual awareness. However, despite her gentle nature, Lalah is fiercely loyal to the man who saved her life - Char Aznable, the scheming "Red Comet."

character.name: Crowley Hamon
character.description: The elegant Hamon is Ramba Ral`s aide and lover, who coordinates her man`s guerilla stratagems from the bridge of the hovercraft Gallop. Despite her flirtatious nature - she even sets her sights on young Amuro at one point - Hamon is passionately devoted to Ramba Ral, and ultimately leads the surviving members of their team in a final attempt to avenge her lover`s defeat.

character.name: Kuroi Sanrensei
character.description: Gaia, Ortega, and Mash, a trio better known as the "Black Tri-Stars," are perhaps Zeon`s most famous ace pilots after "Red Comet" Char Aznable. During the Battle of Loum, they used their famous jetstream attack manoeuvre to capture the Federation`s General Revil. On the eve of Operation Odessa, they`re transferred to Earth to shore up M`quve`s defences, and now the White Base and its pilots will experience the jetstream attack first-hand.

character.name: M`Quve
character.description: The decadent and amoral M`quve is the commander of a huge mining operation in Zeon-occupied Eastern Europe, which extracts vital mineral resources to feed Zeon`s war machine. He reports directly to Kycilia Zabi, taking great pains to conceal the scope of his operation from the other members of the Zabi family. After his base falls to the Federation`s Operation Odessa, M`quve continues serving Kycilia in space, eventually setting a trap for the Gundam at the devastated Texas colony.

character.name: RX-78-2 Gundam
character.description: The Gundam is one of three prototype mobile suits secretly developed by the embattled Earth Federation. After suffering tremendous losses to Zeon`s mobile suits earlier in the war, the Federation set out to create its own, using the very latest advanced technology. The Gundam is the most successful of these prototypes, a close-combat mobile suit protected by tough Luna Titanium armour, and armed with both lethal beam sabers and a devastating beam rifle as powerful as a battleship cannon. It`s also equipped with an advanced computer which learns from its pilot, ultimately enabling it to operate the Gundam automatically. In the hands of accidental pilot Amuro Ray, this one prototype mobile suit proves to be the equal of any Zeon weapon.

character.name: Guncannon
character.description: The Guncannon is the second model of prototype mobile suits developed by the Earth Federation. Designed for medium-range support, it`s equipped with a pair of shell-firing cannons in its shoulders, and can carry a beam rifle for additional firepower. While the Guncannon`s heavy armour means it doesn`t need to carry a shield, its greater weight makes it less agile than the Gundam. Only one Guncannon survives the Zeon attack on the Side 7 research colony, and it`s soon assigned to civilian recruit Kai Shiden.

character.name: Guntank
character.description: The Guntank is the third variety of prototype mobile suit developed by the Earth Federation. Lacking legs and hands, this crude mobile suit is relatively immobile and can`t defend itself in close-range combat, and is thus used mostly for long-range artillery fire. The Guntank is initially manned by driver Ryu Jose and gunner Hayato Kobayashi, and is later modified so that Hayato can operate it single-handedly from the head cockpit.

character.name: RGM-79 GM
character.description: The GM - pronounced "Jim" - is a mass-produced version of the RX-78 Gundam, introduced just before the end of the war. In order to reduce its cost, the GM omits the Gundam`s expensive Luna Titanium armor, Core Block system, and spare beam saber, and substitutes a short-range beam spray gun for the Gundam`s beam rifle. Still, it`s an effective close-combat mobile suit, and in the final campaigns of the war the GM turns the tide in favor of the Federation Forces.

character.name: RB-79 Ball
character.description: The Ball is a mass-produced "mobile pod" armed with a recoilless cannon. These inexpensive vehicles, based on civilian space pods, were created to provide fire support for the Federation Forces` GM mobile suits. Large numbers of Balls are deployed during the Federation`s assaults on the space fortresses Solomon and A Baoa Qu.

character.name: FF-X7 Core Fighter
character.description: This tiny aerospace fighter doubles as a cockpit for the Earth Federation`s Gundam, Guncannon, and Guntank mobile suits. Thanks to the Core Block system used in these prototype mobile suits, the cockpit module can eject and unfold into a fighter plane, allowing the pilot and vital test data to escape to safety. While it`s armed with four vulcan guns and a pair of missile launchers, only a truly reckless pilot would deliberately take a Core Fighter into battle.

character.name: SCV-70 White Base
character.description: This Pegasus-class mobile assault carrier, the besieged home of our crew of young heroes, is the first Earth Federation warship designed to carry mobile suits into battle. Its decks can hold up to nine mobile suits and fighters, and its armament includes a main gun turret, two mega particle cannons, a battery of missile launchers, and countless anti-aircraft guns. Thanks to its Minovsky craft system, the White Base can survive the heat of atmospheric re-entry, and then float effortlessly across the surface of the Earth. The soldiers of the Principality of Zeon, unaware of its true name, give the White Base the nickname "Trojan Horse."

character.name: Salamis
character.description: The Salamis, smaller and less heavily armed than the Magellan, makes up the bulk of the Earth Federation`s space fleet. Its standard armament includes six main guns, six anti-aircraft machine gun turrets, and two missile launchers, but it can also be refitted for reconnaissance and other special missions. Like the Magellan, the Salamis carries a small atmospheric re-entry capsule on its underside.

character.name: Magellan
character.description: The Magellan is the powerhouse of the Federation Space Force, a large, heavily-armed space battleship that`s often used as a flagship by fleet commanders. The Magellan is equipped with seven main gun turrets and 14 anti-aircraft machine gun turrets, but all its firepower can`t protect this mighty warship from Zeon`s mobile suits.

character.name: Musai
character.description: The Musai, the first space warship specifically designed to carry mobile suits, is the mainstay of Zeon`s space fleet. It`s equipped with three mega particle cannon turrets and a battery of missile launchers, and its main deck can store three Zakus. The Komusai capsule stored in the Musai`s prow can be used as an atmospheric re-entry shuttle, with space for two more mobile suits. Char Aznable commands a modified Musai with a distinctive helmet-shaped bridge.

character.name: Zanzibar
character.description: This new model of space cruiser has a streamlined shape which allows it to survive atmospheric re-entry, and its rockets can also function as jet engines for atmospheric flight. With the aid of a booster rocket, the Zanzibar can launch back into space to complete its round trip. This powerful warship is armed with one main gun turret, four fixed-position mega particle cannons, five anti-aircraft machine gun turrets, and a pair of large missile launchers.

character.name: MS-05 Zaku I
character.description: The Zaku I is the original incarnation of the Zaku, produced a few years before the start of the war. Now considered obsolete, it`s used only by non-combat units like the supply corps. One of these primitive Zakus is assigned to Lieutenant Gadem`s Papua-class supply ship, and the old veteran recklessly takes it into battle against the Gundam.

character.name: Zaku II
character.description: The Zaku II is the Principality of Zeon`s standard mass-produced mobile suit. Its manoeuvrability and heavy weaponry make it more than a match for the Earth Federation`s conventional forces. At the start of the war, Zeon`s Zakus wiped out the Earth Federation`s space fleet and overran two-thirds of the planet`s surface, and over the following months the Zaku II has been adapted into several variants for space, land, and even underwater combat. However, it proves to be hopelessly outclassed by the Federation`s prototype mobile suits, and Zeon`s developers begin phasing out the classic Zaku in favor of newer mobile suit designs.

character.name: Zaku II Custom
character.description: This high-performance version of the Zaku II is designed exclusively for squadron commanders and veteran pilots. Although it has more powerful thrusters and a greater propellant supply than the standard Zaku II, the only external difference is the communications antenna on its forehead. Lieutenant Commander Char Aznable - the famous "Red Comet" - pilots this commander`s version of the Zaku II, painted in his trademark colors.

character.name: MS-07B Gouf
character.description: The Gouf is a new land warfare mobile suit, based on the Zaku II. Anticipating the appearance of Federation mobile suits, its designers gave the Gouf a variety of melee weapons - built-in finger machine guns, a defensive shield, and an electrified whip known as a "heat rod." The Gouf also has stronger armour and higher mobility than the Zaku II, making it a formidable close-combat machine. In the hands of a master pilot like Lieutenant Ramba Ral, this sinister-looking mobile suit is capable of duelling even the mighty Gundam.

character.name: Dom
character.description: This land warfare mobile suit. is a radical improvement over the Zaku II and Gouf. While its predecessors were limited to travelling on foot or making brief rocket-assisted jumps, the jet engines in the Dom`s legs turn it into a high-speed hovercraft. With its maneuverability, heavy armor, and powerful bazooka, the Dom is almost unbeatable in ground combat. When Zeon`s dreaded "Black Tri-Stars" use this new model to attack the immobilized White Base, our heroes are hard-pressed to fight them off.

character.name: MS-09R Rick Dom
character.description: With the development of the MS-14 Gelgoog far behind schedule, the Zeon military decided to adapt the land warfare mobile suit Dom for space combat. The result is the Rick Dom, in which the jet engines that give the Dom its hovering capabilities are replaced by rockets. Otherwise, it`s basically the same as the land version - a fast, heavily-armoured mobile suit armed with a devastating bazooka. By the end of the war, the Rick Dom has all but replaced the Zaku II in the ranks of Zeon`s space forces.

character.name: MS-14 Gelgoog
character.description: With the Gelgoog, the Principality of Zeon at last creates a mobile suit to rival the Earth Federation`s Gundam. The Gelgoog boasts high performance and sturdy armor like that of the Rick Dom, but it`s also equipped with powerful beam weapons. Although it`s the best mass-produced mobile suit to appear in the war, the Gelgoog arrives too late to change the course of the conflict, and due to Zeon`s manpower shortage it`s piloted mostly by inexperienced trainees.

character.name: Gelgoog Custom
character.description: This is one of a handful of prototype Gelgoogs produced for testing purposes. As usual, Char Aznable has tuned it to his own specifications and given it his trademark color scheme. At the controls of this prototype Gelgoog, the famed "Red Comet" battles the Gundam at the Texas colony, and subsequently uses it to escort Lalah Sune`s mobile armor Elmeth into combat.

character.name: Gyan
character.description: The prototype mobile suit Gyan was developed, under the supervision of Captain M`quve, as a competitor to the Gelgoog. However, its lack of long-range weapons and poor space manoeuvrability led to the project`s cancellation. Undaunted, M`quve uses one of the surviving Gyan prototypes in a cunning attack on the Gundam at the Texas colony, employing its arsenal of bombs and missiles to lure his enemy into duelling range.

character.name: MSM-03 Gogg
character.description: The Gogg is Zeon`s first mass-produced amphibious mobile suit. Like the later models in the series, it`s a squat, monstrous machine with thick pressure-resistant armour and multi-segmented arms tipped with sharp claws. The water-cooled reactor housed within the Gogg`s hulking torso is large enough to power a pair of built-in mega particle cannons. However, the Gogg can only operate for short periods out of the water.

character.name: MSM-04 Acguy
character.description: The Acguy is an amphibious mobile suit derived from the Gogg, which emphasizes stealth over brute power. It`s often used for reconnaissance and infiltration missions, as when Char Aznable leads a team of Acguys in a guerilla attack on the Federation Forces` Jaburo headquarters. The Acguy`s extendable right arm houses a mega particle cannon and a set of sharp claws, while its left arm contains a battery of rocket launchers.

character.name: MSM-07 Z`gok
character.description: The Z`gok is the most advanced of Zeon`s amphibious mobile suits. Its 360-degree mono-eye sensor and arm-mounted mega particle cannons enable it to fire in any direction. With both air- and water-cooling systems, the Z`gok can operate for long periods on land, and its rocket engines give it superb mobility even out of the water.

character.name: Z`gok Custom
character.description: In his attacks on the Federation Forces`s Jaburo headquarters, Char Aznable pilots an upgraded, higher-performance version of the amphibious Z`gok, which is powerful enough to punch through a Federation mobile suit with a single blow. As usual, the "Red Comet" gives this mobile suit his distinctive personal colour scheme.

character.name: Zock
character.description: This experimental amphibious mobile suit could almost be characterized as a mobile gun platform. The Zock`s huge body houses a battery of mega particle cannons, which can fire both forward and backward. Incapable of walking on its vestigial legs, it moves by hovering, or in jet-assisted jumps. One prototype Zock is used in Char Aznable`s assault on the Federation Forces`s Jaburo base.

character.name: MAM-07 Grabro
character.description: This marine mobile armor is armed with 14 torpedo launchers and a pair of massive claws, which it can use to tear open the undersides of enemy ships. The Grabro can also take on airborne targets, lurking beneath the surface of the water and attacking with a pair of missile launchers. Zeon submarine captain Flanagan Boone uses the Grabro to attack the White Base as it crosses the Atlantic Ocean.

character.name: Adzam
character.description: This mobile gun platform, Adzam, is the predecessor to Zeon`s series of huge, non-humanoid mobile armors. Its Minovsky craft system enables it to float through the air for brief periods, attacking ground targets with its eight mega particle cannon turrets and the electrical weapon known as the "Adzam leader." In Central Asia, Captain M`quve and Kycilia Zabi co-pilot the Adzam in an attempt to drive the Gundam away from one of their precious mining bases.

character.name: Zakrello
character.description: The Zakrello is a failed mobile armour prototype, whose speed and manoeuvrability were deemed inadequate for combat purposes. The gaping mouth of this peculiar-looking machine contains a powerful scattering mega particle cannon and it`s also armed with eight missile launchers and a pair of sickle-shaped claws. After the destruction of the Bigro, one of Char`s underlings takes off in the Zakrello in an attempt for revenge.

character.name: Bigro
character.description: The Bigro is a space mobile armor, distinguished by its incredible speed. Armed with a pair of claws, a powerful mega particle cannonmega particle cannon, and eight missile launchers, it`s ideal for high-speed hit-and-run attacks. When the White Base returns to space after its stopover at Jaburo, it`s pursued by a Bigro launched from Char Aznable`s Zanzibar-class cruiser.

character.name: Braw Bro
character.description: The Braw Bro is one of Zeon`s first Newtype mobile armors, equipped with the mind-machine interface known as the psycommu system. Its wire-guided mega particle cannon ordinarily require individual gunners, but Newtype pilot Challia Bull is able to coordinate all four turrets to attack his target from multiple directions. The Braw Bro`s main body can break apart into three sections, including an escape capsule for the pilots.

character.name: Elmeth
character.description: This elegant Newtype mobile armor carries a complement of remote-controlled weapons called "Bits," each of which has its own mega particle cannon, sensors, and rocket thrusters. A sufficiently powerful Newtype pilot, like Ensign Lalah Sune, can use these wireless Bits to attack enemies at immense distances. The Elmeth is also a powerful fighting machine in its own right - fast, maneuverable, and armed with a pair of lethal mega particle cannons.

character.name: Zeong
character.description: The huge Zeong, designed exclusively for Newtype pilots, is the first mobile suit equipped with a psycommu system. Thanks to this mind-machine interface, a Newtype pilot can use the Zeong`s detachable hands as remote-controlled gun turrets and attack his target from three directions at once. During the Battle of A Baoa Qu at the end of the war, Char Aznable takes the incomplete, legless Zeong into battle in a last attempt to defeat the Federation`s Gundam.

character.name: Big Zam
character.description: This huge, two-legged mobile armor is transferred to Zeon`s space fortress Solomon just before the Federation Forces launch their assault. In addition to one large and 28 small mega particle cannon, the Big Zam is outfitted with an I-field barrier that deflects all enemy beam weapons. With Space Attack Force commander Dozle Zabi at its helm, the Big Zam wreaks havoc upon the Federation`s space fleet, until the Gundam defeats its protective barrier by attacking it at point-blank range.

character.name: Mineva Lao Zabi
character.description: As the child heir to the Zabi dynasty, Mineva is the nominal leader of the Zeon renegades who took refuge at the asteroid base Axis. The daughter of Zeon admiral Dozle Zabi, Mineva was a mere infant when her people fled to the asteroid belt, and her whole life has been spent in preparation for her glorious destiny as the ruler of a revived Principality of Zeon. However, beneath the royal finery and behind the rehearsed speeches is a lonely little girl, starved of affection and longing for companionship. Source: Official Site She makes her first appearance as a new born in episode 34 of http://anidb.net/a715 [Mobile Suit Gundam]. She later appears in http://anidb.net/a719 [Zeta Gundam] and she is the female lead of http://anidb.net/a6517 [Gundam Unicorn], under the alias http://anidb.net/ch13499 [Audrey Burn].

character.name: Kikka Kitamoto
character.description: Katz Hawin, Letz Cofan, and Kikka Kitamoto are three of the younger refugees who escape from Side 7 aboard the White Base. Having lost their parents, they latch onto their caretaker Fraw Bow and the rest of the ship`s crew, and soon become the White Base`s beloved mascots. Often mischievous, and always noisy, they nonetheless prove to be just as vital to the ship`s survival as their older crewmates. Source: Official Site

character.name: Letz Cofan
character.description: Katz Hawin, Letz Cofan, and Kikka Kitamoto are three of the younger refugees who escape from Side 7 aboard the White Base. Having lost their parents, they latch onto their caretaker Fraw Bow and the rest of the ship`s crew, and soon become the White Base`s beloved mascots. Often mischievous, and always noisy, they nonetheless prove to be just as vital to the ship`s survival as their older crewmates. Source: Official Site

character.name: Katz Hawin
character.description: Katz Hawin, Letz Cofan, and Kikka Kitamoto are three of the younger refugees who escape from Side 7 aboard the White Base. Having lost their parents, they latch onto their caretaker Fraw Bow and the rest of the ship`s crew, and soon become the White Base`s beloved mascots. Often mischievous, and always noisy, they nonetheless prove to be just as vital to the ship`s survival as their older crewmates. Source: Official Site

character.name: Paolo Cassius
character.description: The first captain of the White Base, he is mortally wounded when the ship was attacked inside Side 7 by a Zeon scout team. Commanding the ship even in his wounded condition, he eventually dies due to his injuries, turning over command to Bright Noa. Source: gundam.wikia.com

character.name: Icelina Eschonbach
character.description: Icelina is Garma Zabi`s lover, and first meets him after Zeon forces occupy New York. After the death of Garma, she asks a Zeon officer to lead a special mission to destroy the White Base. Source: gundam.wikia.com

character.name: Miharu Ratokie
character.description: Miharu is a citizen living in Belfast, Ireland, and a spy for the Principality of Zeon. She uses the gold paid to her by the Zeon forces in order to support her younger brother and sister since their parents are deceased due to the war. Source: gundam.wikia.com

character.name: Conscon
character.description: Conscon is the commander of a Principality of Zeon mobile task force, consisting of a Chivvay-class heavy cruiser and some Musai-class light cruisers, under the command of Dozle Zabi. Under Dozle`s orders, he is dispatched to Side 6 to ambush the White Base. Source: gundam.wikia.com

character.name: Akahana
character.description: Akahana is a mobile suit pilot and explosives expert belonging to the Principality of Zeon`s Marine Corps and Intelligence Strategy department of Kycilia Zabi`s Zeon Mobile Assault Force. Source: gundam.wikia.com

L`Atlantico si tinge di rosso

Black Tri-Star
La Triade Nera

マ・クベ包囲網を破れ

La trappola di M`Quve
마 쿠베의 포위망을 돌파하라
M`Quve Houimou o Yabure
ニュータイプ, シャリア・ブル

宇宙要塞ア・バオア・クー
Space Fortress: A Baoa Qu
La fortezza spaziale di A Baoa Qu
우주요새 아 바오아 쿠
Uchuu Yousai A Baoa Qu
再会, シャアとセイラ
Char And Sayla
Char e Sayla
재회, 샤아와 세이라
Saikai, Char to Sayla

Hand-To-Hand Combat
Corpo a corpo
사투! 화이트베이스
Shitou! White Base
灼熱のアッザム・リーダー
Zeon`s Secret Mine
Il giacimento segreto di Zeon
작열의 앗잠 리다
Shakunetsu no Adzam Leader
ククルス・ドアンの島
Cucuruz Doan`s Island
쿠쿨스 도안의 섬
Cucuruz Doan no Shima
